message: Happy New Year! I am excited for a new year, new Congress and new direction for our great nation. I am truly blessed to represent the great folks of District 15, and I pray for the Lord's guidance as we journey into the New Year together. May this New Year bring you peace, good health, blessings and prosperity. Here's to 2017! God Bless you all and the United States of America!

Today, I proudly reintroduced my resolution for the 115th Congress to condemn President Obama and the U.N. for their anti-Israel vote. We MUST #StandWithIsrael.   http://m.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/jan/3/dems-absent-house-gop-resolution-un-israel-vote/

I proudly cosponsored legislation (H.R. 299) today to expand benefits for Vietnam Blue Water Navy Veterans exposed to Agent Orange. There is absolutely no reason those veterans who served in the waters off the coast of Vietnam and currently suffer from diseases related to Agent Orange exposure should not qualify for current VA care. They are the backbone of the freedom and prosperity America has enjoyed for more than two hundred years, and I refuse to let their sacrifices and service go undervalued and unnoticed.   http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398540

I was proud to stand up for Israel today on the House Floor and condemn the anti-Israel UN Security Council Resolution 2334, and President Obama for turning his back on our closest ally in the Middle East by failing to veto this dangerous resolution. Click below to watch my Floor speech:   https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4641753/rep-dennis-ross-unisrael-resolution

Today is Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, a day to celebrate and acknowledge the contributions that countless men and women in uniform make on a daily basis to keep our communities safe and secure. I also want to extend my deepest sympathies and prayers to the families and communities of the two officers from Orlando and Orange County, Florida, who were tragically killed in the line of duty today.   As we honor the Thin Blue Line, let’s always remember they put on their uniforms every day with the realization that they may never come home. That kind of selflessness and bravery deserves our recognition and support not just today, but every day.

Today, I sent letters to House Veteran Affairs Committee Chairman Phil Roe, the U.S. Air Force and House Armed Services Committee Chairman Mac Thornberry, all regarding Vietnam veterans being denied Veterans Affairs (VA) benefits for diseases associated with Agent Orange, a toxic herbicide sprayed by the U.S. during the Vietnam War to clear out foliage.   I have spoken to countless Veterans, including many in my own district, suffering from devastating cancers and diseases attributed to Agent Orange who bravely served in the territorial seas of Vietnam and in Guam. However, many of them are told they do not qualify for VA benefits for their disabilities. These veterans, and their families, deserve the care and benefits they earned, and I won't stop fighting for them until they receive the help they need.   For more information about the letters I sent, please click on the link below:  https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398543

Since I was first elected, securing our border has been a top priority of mine. I reintroduced the Finish the Fence Act because finishing the construction of the fence along our Southwest border is the first incremental step in securing our border, providing for our national security, and halting the massive influx of illegal entry into our country.  I refuse to put American lives at risk and let our laws on the books continue to be ignored. This is not just an issue of illegal immigrants crossing our porous border. This is also an issue of national security. We cannot waste any more time on this, and I call on my colleagues to join me in demanding that this fence be finished.  http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398544
Ross Votes to Repeal and Replace Obamacare: http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398545

When Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. first stepped foot in Rockefeller Chapel 60 years ago, his Montgomery home had been bombed just months earlier. However, his words were not marked by hate or revenge. Instead, he called on the crowd to "resist with your heart and strength the forces of evil."  With his voice, with his actions, and with his dignity, Dr. King brought hope and healing to America. Dr. King’s fearless efforts were a driving force behind the enactment of the Voting Rights Act and equality for all. On this day, we commemorate the timeless values he taught us through his own examples — the values of courage, truth, justice, compassion, humility and service that so defined his character and empowered his leadership. We also recognize the unconditional love, forgiveness and nonviolence that empowered his revolutionary movement.   As we embark on new beginnings, let us remember to emulate Dr. King’s call for unity, peace, love and justice. I call on all of you to make a personal commitment to serve humanity with the same vibrant spirit that was Dr. King’s greatest strength. May God Bless you all, and May God Bless the United States of America.

ICYMI: Rep. Ross' interview on Fox and Friends this morning discussing the left's tired attempts to discredit President-elect Donald Trump, as well as the imminent need for stronger border security.  http://video.foxnews.com/v/video-embed.html?video_id=5282081571001

I was honored today to recognize All Saints' Academy students Noah Horowitz, Trevor Hallett, Robert Lane and Will Harding for placing first in the Congressional App Challenge for the 15th District of Florida. Seeing what these students are capable of creating when given the encouragement to do so is truly inspirational. Keep up the great work!
Congratulations to Donald J. Trump on becoming the 45th President of the United States of America! #MakeAmericaGreatAgain
Today, I proudly voted to make the Hyde Amendment permanent and government-wide so we can protect God's precious children.   http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398548

I couldn't agree more with President Trump--border security is a must! That is why I reintroduced my Finish the Fence Act, which directs Homeland Security to complete the required 700-mile Southwest border fencing. This is not only an issue of immigration reform, but also an issue of national security. This is the first step in better protecting the American people and those abiding by the laws of our land.

We must never forget the horrifying events of the Holocaust, nor those who were killed or the survivors who bear the scars to tell of this dark and depraved time in our world's history. #NeverAgain #HolocaustRemembranceDay

This is long overdue. We must ensure our country is safe from radical Islamic jihadists who are entering the U.S. under the guise of refuge with the intent to harm and kill Americans.   http://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-is-signing-executive-orders-on-military-rebuilding-immigration-vetting-1485554165

So I may better serve the great folks of Florida's 15th Congressional District, I am excited to announce the opening of my third district office located in Clermont, Lake County.   http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398555

We currently have Vietnam War Era veterans suffering from diseases due to Agent Orange exposure, but they do not qualify for VA benefits to help with their life-threatening ailments because the DOD denies this toxic herbicide was used in the areas they claim to have been exposed. This is heartbreaking and shocking, and it cannot go on any longer. I proudly introduced the FOSTER Act so these courageous veterans, who put our lives before their own, can receive the help and services they deserve.  To read more about my legislation, click on the link below:  http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398557

February is American Heart Month! Join me in staying educated, being proactive, supporting one another, and advocating for heart health.  https://www.heart.org/HEARTORG/General/Heart-and-Stroke-Association-Statistics_UCM_319064_SubHomePage.jsp

I was honored and proud to speak with President Trump today about the issues affecting our nation and, especially, District 15. There is going to be a lot of hard work ahead of us, but we are on our way to creating jobs, securing our border, reforming our tax code, and better protecting our country and its people.

I am happy to announce that I reintroduced my legislation to grant a federal charter to the National Academy of Inventors (NAI). This bill will help today’s inventors throughout District 15 and the United States continue to develop leading edge technology that focuses on providing a better future for America.  Members of the NAI have the ability to innovate, but without funding or recognition, their inventions are just a dream. I want to give these students the opportunity to conduct proper research and development to create the new technologies that will keep our nation at the forefront of innovation. We must recognize the public need to help our entrepreneurs and innovators whose work encourages economic growth.  http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398559
Thank you to all of the wonderful people at the Options for Women breakfast today for the great discussion about preserving the sanctity of life, family and religious freedom.

It is one of the highest honors I have as a Member of Congress to assist deserving students in seeking appointments to our United States Service Academies. If you are interested in attending one of our esteemed service academies, stop by my office's next Service Academy Information Day:  Saturday, March 4, 2017, from 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM Hillsborough Community College, Plant City Campus Trinkle Center 1206 N Park Road, Plant City, FL 33563  Click the link below to read more about academy appointments and to download an nomination application:   http://dennisross.house.gov/constituentservices/serviceacademynominations.htm

In just three terms in office, I have returned more than $635,000 of my Congressional office budget to the Treasury. If every day, hardworking Americans can live responsibly and on tight budgets, there is no reason our federal government cannot do the same, especially when it is spending taxpayer dollars. I am deeply honored to represent the 15th District of Florida, and I will continue to operate on a conservative, smart budget throughout my time serving in Congress.  Press Release: http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398560

Happy President's Day! Today, we honor not only the lives of Presidents Washington and Lincoln, but every leader of the Free World for their patriotism and unparalleled influence on America. Through faith, strength of character, and determination of spirit, these men brought civility and unity in times of chaos and division--the same civility and unity we must continue to uphold today.  Presidents of each generation have aspired to serve the common good, recognizing that whether we choose to rise or fall, we will all do so together. On this special day, we must unite as a nation in rededicating ourselves to maintain the freedoms we hold most dear. I ask that you join me in praying for our President as he leads and defends our great nation. May God bless every one of you and the United States of America.
ICYMI: Rep. Ross' Floor Speech Recognizing American Heart Month (click link below to watch)  https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4656872/rep-dennis-ross-heart-month-floor-speech

I am proud to represent District 15 at President Trump's rally this evening in Melbourne, Florida! We are going to secure our borders, repeal AND replace Obamacare, and allow you to keep more of your hard earned money. The previous administration failed to listen to the American People for 8 years, but we are putting a stop to that right here and now. You spoke, and we are going to fight for and listen to YOU. God Bless!

We are a proud nation of immigrants, but we are also a nation of laws. These laws are meant to protect us, and I am incredibly thankful to see Polk County Sheriff Grady Judd upholding these laws to protect the people of District 15 and the State of Florida.

Thank you to Mr. Daren Essig and the students, teachers and faculty of Turkey Creek Middle School for allowing me to speak with you all today about the importance of civics education and involvement. We must continue to encourage our youth so they understand and engage in our democratic process to help our communities and better themselves.
NA
Happy National Strawberry Day! Join me in supporting our local strawberry growers, like those in the Winter Strawberry Capital of the World, Plant City!
It was great seeing my good friends Auburn University President Jay Gogue, Charles McCrary and Jimmy Rane today in D.C. What a fantastic group of men. #WarEagle
I hope to see you at the Florida Strawberry Festival for some great music, fun and strawberry shortcake!  http://wfla.com/2017/03/01/florida-strawberry-festival-what-to-know-before-you-go/

This week, I sent a letter to Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Secretary David Shulkin, asking the VA to help veterans suffering from diseases associated with Agent Orange exposure while stationed in Guam during the Vietnam War. We owe these selfless veterans a debt we can never truly repay, and we must provide them the help and care they deserve.   To view my letter, click here: http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398564

What a great turnout at today's U.S. Service Academy Information Day! It is wonderful to see so many young people inspired to serve and defend our nation. If you are interested in attending a U.S. Service Academy, you may read more about the application process here: http://dennisross.house.gov/constituentservices/serviceacademynominations.htm

To bring greater transparency to the activities union officials are conducting while being paid by the American taxpayer, I reintroduced my legislation (H.R. 1293) to better account for federal employees' use of "official time" -- time used to perform union activities while on the clock during the official workday. At a time when our country is nearly $20 trillion in debt, we need to ensure we are better accounting for the use of taxpayer dollars.   Read more about H.R. 1293 here: http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398566

I am honored to receive the Family Research Council Action’s “True Blue” Award for my 100 percent pro-family voting record. You have my word that I will continue to fight for families, the unborn and religious freedom.     http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398567

I am proud to join my good friend, Rep. Kathy Castor, in reintroducing my bipartisan bill, the Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act. This legislation encourages the development of a robust private flood insurance market that can offer homeowners options in terms of pricing and coverage.   This bill passed unanimously out of the full House of Representatives last Congress, and I encourage my colleagues in both the House and Senate to join me in pushing for this sensible flood insurance reform that will benefit homeowners and families.  http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398568

Today, I had a fantastic discussion with Wesley DiSilvestro and Grace Miller from the YMCA Youth in Government program. I could not be prouder of their involvement in our communities and government. These students are trail blazers, and I encourage more of our youth to join civics programs like the YMCA's. I would like to thank Sean Casey and Daphne Delgado for their work with this great program and passion for our young people and their futures.

The singular most important duty of Congress is to provide for our nation’s defense. At a time when we are threatened every day by radical Islamic jihadists, we must support and rebuild our military to prevent harm to our country, its people and our allies. That is why my colleagues and I united today to pass the bipartisan Department of Defense Appropriations Act.   This legislation outfits our military force to conduct successful operations, as well as ensures full benefits for our troops, military families and retirees. I am honored to represent thousands of servicemen and women in my district, and I will continue to provide them the tools they need to protect our great nation  https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398569

The singular most important duty of Congress is to provide for our nation’s defense. At a time when we are threatened every day by radical Islamic jihadists, we must support and rebuild our military to prevent harm to our country, its people and our allies. That is why my colleagues and I united today to pass the bipartisan Department of Defense Appropriations Act.   This legislation outfits our military force to conduct successful operations, as well as ensures full benefits for our troops, military families and retirees. I am honored to represent thousands of servicemen and women in my district, and I will continue to provide them the tools they need to protect our great nation.  https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398569

This week, I proudly introduced the Fair and Open Competition Act, which will reduce costs for taxpayers by encouraging all qualified construction companies to compete for federal and federally-funded construction projects. This common-sense legislation will create more construction jobs, and therefore, help increase competition, reduce waste, and eliminate favoritism in the procurement process. I urge my colleges to immediately pass the Fair and Open Competition Act and put an end to these anti-competitive and costly contracting schemes.  Press Release: http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398570

It was great to speak with so many Tampa Bay and local businesses today about issues that are important to District 15, Florida and our nation. Thank you all for your leadership and positive influence in our communities. You all are what help run our country and its economy. I also want to thank Tampa Bay Partnership and Reps. Kathy Castor, Vern Buchanan and Gus Bilirakis for their efforts and participation in today's meeting. I look forward to working with you all as we continue to support local businesses and the entrepreneurial spirit.

Happy National Agriculture Day! Florida's agriculture industry is one of the best around, and District 15 is known for its miles of citrus groves and the winter strawberry capital of the world, Plant City. Florida's growers, farmers and ranchers help feed the world and preserve our state's amazing agriculture history and reputation. Join me in supporting our local and state agriculture industry and products!  http://www.freshfromflorida.com/

We must immediately repeal the failed policies of Obamacare, and replace them with a robust and vibrant health insurance market that puts patients and doctors back in charge of their healthcare decisions. Click on the link below to read my op-ed on how we are going to provide real, affordable options and choices for all Americans, just like we promised to do.   http://www.sunshinestatenews.com/story/congress-must-pass-ahca-repeal-and-replace-obamacare

Thank you to the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee for passing H.R. 1552! We are gaining ground on increasing fair competition and lowering costs in our nation's construction industry.   https://www.abc.org/NewsMedia/Newsline/tabid/143/entryid/8306/take-action-ask-congress-to-end-government-mandated-plas-in-federal-contracting.aspx

Good luck to all the students participating in the State Science and Engineering Fair of Florida! These bright young minds are our future innovators who will inspire generations to follow. Keep up the hard work!   http://www.theledger.com/news/20170330/polk-students-shine-at-florida-science-fair

Our selfless and courageous Veterans need our help! I am happy to see the House Veterans' Affairs Committee is holding a hearing this Wednesday on H.R. 299, the Blue Water Navy Vietnam Veterans Act. This important legislation would provide presumptive status to Vietnam Veterans exposed to Agent Orange while serving in Vietnam's territorial waters so they may receive VA assistance for their Agent Orange-related diseases. They put their lives on the line for us, and we owe them the care and help they deserve.   http://veterans.house.gov/calendar/eventsingle.aspx?EventID=1667

Sun 'n Fun International Fly-In and Expo kicks off today! Make sure you don't miss out on the great activities and events going on this week at the Lakeland Linder Regional Airport.   http://www.flysnf.org/

President Trump's decisive and immediate military action speaks loud and clear that the U.S. will not stand for the Assad regime's evil treatment of innocent lives, including babies and children. I support President Trump's decision to launch this targeted military strike and pray it will deter the Assad regime from barbaric attacks on civilians in the future. May God bless our service men and women who carried out this mission, and may God continue to bless and watch over all His children around the world.
Congratulations to Judge Neil Gorsuch on being confirmed as our nation's newest Supreme Court Justice!   Press Release:  http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398576

Congratulations to Amber Johnson from Lakeland Christian School for winning the 2017 Congressional Art Competition for the 15th Congressional District of Florida! I am so proud of all of the talented students who participated in this year's competition.

"Passing the Fair and Open Competition Act (H.R. 1552/S. 622), which was introduced by Rep. Dennis Ross (R-Fla.) and Sen. Jeff Flake (R-Ariz.), would allow America’s entire construction workforce . . . to compete on a level playing field by ensuring that taxpayer-funded construction cannot be subjected to costly and discriminatory government-mandated project labor agreements (PLAs)."   http://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/economy-budget/328153-create-equal-opportunity-for-entire-construction-industry

While recently visiting Kuwait and Iraq with some of my fellow Members, we had the amazing opportunity to meet with the Florida National Guard stationed in Kuwait. Being able to shake these brave soldiers' hands and thank them for their service in person was an honor. I was deeply touched by the hundreds of letters we received from students in District 15 to deliver to our soldiers. I pray God continues to keep them safe, as they selflessly do for us every day.  I want to thank the U.S. Ambassador to Kuwait, Lawrence Silverman, for his generous hospitality. I encourage more of my colleagues to visit Kuwait to fully see and understand how dynamic and contributing the country is to the overall financial well-being of the Middle East. We also had the pleasure of meeting with Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi, U.S. Ambassador Douglas Silliman, Parliament Speaker Salim al-Jabouri, and U.S. military officials while in Iraq. We received valuable information on joint military operations and preventing ISIS from gaining more ground in Iraq. We must continue our efforts to defeat ISIS so Iraq can become a booming democracy in the Middle East.   I lastly want to thank Reps. Darren Soto, Neal Dunn, Stephen Lynch and Bob Latta, the U.S. Army, the Embassies of Kuwait and Iraq, and participating District 15 schools for helping make this memorable event happen.  https://www.army.mil/article/185997

I am incredibly moved by Audrey Link and her drawing that was chosen by the Department of Justice to be used in the campaign for the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children. We must keep pressure on this heartbreaking issue in our nation. I am proud to see our young people, like Audrey, getting involved and caring about our hurt and missing children. We must work together to bring our kids safely home.   http://www.abcactionnews.com/news/region-polk/lakeland/doj-selects-lakeland-girls-drawing-for-national-missing-kids-campaign

This weekend, people across the world will join in holy celebrations, drawing joy from their worship and praise. In America, we are incredibly blessed with the freedom of religion as one of our central founding principles. As we draw strength from our unity as a people who trust in God, we must remember to pray for those who are persecuted for practicing their beliefs and for their faith in the Lord.     Beginning today on Good Friday, and concluding on Easter Sunday, Christians will celebrate the resurrection of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. We will remember that He gave His body and His blood to wash away our sins so we may have everlasting life and redemption. In our rejoicing, we will renew the hope that is ours through Christ who has risen.  Cindy, Shane, Travis and I wish you all an Easter weekend filled with joy, praise, family and love, and pray that one day, men, women and children everywhere will be able to worship God freely.  ~ Romans 5:6-10 ~

Happy Easter, District 15! May God continue to bless you all and this great nation.   "Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! In his great mercy, He has given us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead." ~ 1 Peter 1:3
Thank you so much to South Lake Hospital for taking the time to meet with me today and to share the fantastic work you are doing to serve and improve healthcare in our community.

Today, I had the wonderful privilege of visiting with Erik Segalini to learn more about the great programs New Beginnings of Central Florida provides to help our homeless, hungry and poor live responsible lives filled with hope and courage. Thank you and God Bless you for all you do!  https://www.nbcfl.org/about/

Happy National Park Week! When I was a child, my parents loved the outdoors and took our family camping all over the United States. Cindy and I continued this special tradition with our two sons, traveling in an RV across the country to national parks and wildlife preserves every chance we could find.   As an avid outdoorsman, I cherish our natural lands, and I support their preservation. I encourage you all to join me in visiting and appreciating the beautiful lands God has given us.   Click on the link below to find national parks in Florida: https://www.nps.gov/state/fl/index.htm
Happy Earth Day! Join me in celebrating God's beautiful creations.

What a great group of folks at today's Lakeland South Rotary meeting! Thank you all for inviting me to join you and for the discussions about important issues affecting District 15 and our nation. I look forward to seeing you, again, soon.

I'm thrilled to see the Guam Legislature unanimously pass Vice Speaker Therese M. Terlaje’s resolution in support of the FOSTER Act. This victory furthers our momentum to provide our courageous Vietnam War veterans suffering from Agent Orange-related diseases due to their service in Guam the benefits and care they deserve. I won't stop fighting for our selfless veterans until justice is served.   Press Release: http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398579
As we celebrate and recognize #SmallBusinessWeek, I ask that you join me in supporting our local small businesses that keep our community and economy running!

Happy National Orange Juice Day! Florida produces the most orange juice in our nation, and is the second largest producer in the entire world. I am proud to represent a community and state that is known for such a rich characteristic and wonderful product. I hope that you will join me in supporting our orange juice industry and the fantastic people who work in it.   http://www.floridacitrus.org/oj/
Happy National Day of Prayer! ~ Ephesians 6:18 ~  Click on the link below to read Rep. Ross' statement:  http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398583

After seven long years, Americans across Florida and the entire nation can breathe a sigh of relief today because we fulfilled our promise to repeal and replace Obamacare. By working with President Trump and uniting to pass the American Health Care Act (AHCA), we are putting patients first and ending an era of skyrocketing premiums, massive tax hikes and burdensome mandates and penalties.  I encourage the Senate to quickly take up and pass the AHCA so President Trump can finally sign into law the repeal of Obamacare, and we can provide Americans relief and access to affordable plans they need and prefer.   http://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398584

This week, I was incredibly honored to receive the Hungarian Knight's Cross Order of Merit. I am proud to carry on my family's heritage and friendship with so many Hungarian-Americans in our nation and with the wonderful people and leaders of Hungary and its Embassy through the Congressional Hungarian Caucus. I want to thank Hungarian Ambassador Reka Szemerkényi for all of her admirable work to champion a strong relationship between the U.S. and Hungary, and I look forward to working with the incoming ambassador, Hungary Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Laszlo Szabo, to further strengthen the friendship between our nations.

If you are planning a trip to D.C. this summer, my office is here to help you. Visit the link below to submit your tour request information through my D.C. office, and if you have any questions about tours, please do not hesitate to call my office at 202-225-1252. I look forward to seeing you in D.C.!  http://dennisross.house.gov/constituentservices/washingtondc.htm

Happy Mother's Day to all of the amazing mothers of District 15 and across our great state and nation! My siblings and I were incredibly blessed to have had such a caring, loving and beautiful mother whose gentle and kind soul touched everyone who had the pleasure of knowing her. I know she is in Heaven now watching over all of us every day.   My sons and I are also blessed to have my wife, Cindy, in our lives. She is our rock, a wonderful mother, and a courageous woman. There isn't a day that goes by that I don't thank the Lord for allowing her to be my partner through thick and thin. Thank you, Cindy, for all you do for our family.    Proverbs 31:25-30 ~ "She is clothed with strength and dignity; she can laugh at the days to come. She speaks with wisdom, and faithful instruction is on her tongue. She watches over the affairs of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness. Her children arise and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her: 'Many women do noble things, but you surpass them all.' Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised."

This week is Hurricane Preparedness Week. As Hurricane Season starts next month, it is never too early to start preparing and protecting our families from these devastating storms, just like Hurricanes Hermine and Matthew that hit Florida hard last year. Below is a link to my website that provides tips and information to help you and your family start your hurricane protection planning:   http://dennisross.house.gov/constituentservices/hurricane-preparedness.htm

To those who shape our children's futures, encourage them to pursue their dreams, and believe in their true capabilities, we thank you today, and every day. Happy National Teacher Appreciation Day! #ThankATeacher

As the son of a World War II Navy Veteran, and the brother of three Veterans, I have a deep appreciation for the service and sacrifices made by our nation’s military members. We, as a country, are truly blessed to have such dedicated patriots willing to answer the call to service and to defend our freedoms every single day. Join me this month in honoring and thanking the most advanced fighting force the world has ever seen for protecting our home and its people. May God continue to watch over our brave and selfless soldiers.   http://www.military.com/military-appreciation-month

This week, we recognize and celebrate National Police Week. Thank you to all of the courageous and selfless men and women in law enforcement who protect and help our communities 24 hours a day, seven days a week, 365 days a year. You all put your lives on the line every single day, and we are forever grateful for your service. May God Bless you all and your families.

Big thanks to Judy Proli and everyone who attended today's breakfast in Clermont. I greatly appreciate your thoughts, concerns and questions about how we can make District 15 and our nation safer, stronger and more prosperous for ALL Americans. I look forward to seeing you again!

For seven years, Obamacare has failed and harmed the American people, causing them to pay billions of dollars in burdensome taxes and skyrocketing premiums. Doing nothing and letting these broken promises spiral even more out of control was not an option, which is why I voted to pass the American Health Care Act (AHCA). Click on the link below to read my op-ed that dispels the myths about the AHCA.   http://www.sunshinestatenews.com/story/dispelling-myths-real-facts-about-ahca

My bipartisan legislation, the Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act, will help increase options and lower costs for consumers purchasing flood insurance. This sensible legislation passed unanimously out of committee and the full House last Congress. As hurricane season approaches, I encourage my colleagues in both the House and Senate to quickly take up and pass this bill so we can help Floridians and all Americans better prepare for flooding disasters.   http://thehill.com/blogs/pundits-blog/state-local-politics/333454-floridas-private-flood-insurance-market-is-a-template

Happy Armed Forces Day! Thank you to our military branches and their members for your willingness to stand ready to defend and protect our nation.   http://www.military.com/military-appreciation-month/history-of-armed-forces-day.html

Congratulations to Jessica Jenkins, Ryan Johnson, Daniel Moore, Connor Smith and George Madden from District 15 for receiving appointments to our esteemed U.S. Service Academies! What an honor and feat. I admire your selfless dedication to the United States and its people. I also want to congratulate Odaly Lennis-Ramos for receiving the General James A. Van Fleet Scholarship. Keep up the great work!   https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398586

I am incredibly happy to announce that my "official time" reporting bill passed unanimously by voice in the House of Representatives today. I encourage my Senate colleagues to quickly take up and pass this important legislation so we can provide better accountability and transparency for the use of taxpayer dollars. On this Memorial Day, whether you are hosting a cookout with friends and family, spending time at the pool or beach, or just enjoying the comfort of your air-conditioned home, I ask that you take a moment to reflect, give thanks and remember our fallen service members who gave their lives protecting and defending our nation.    Freedom is never free. We must recognize and honor the ultimate sacrifices these brave heroes made for our country and its people, because without them, we would not be the great nation we are today. On this day, and every day, may God bless our military heroes, their loving families, and the entire United States of America.

I was truly honored to participate in and speak at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) ribbon cutting ceremony for its new Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) facility at the Lakeland Linder Regional Airport, which will include three hurricane hunter airplanes.   These aircraft offer a vital service to the State of Florida by flying into hurricanes, and measuring their intensity and forecasting their paths for our safety. I want to thank Lakeland Linder Airport Director Gene Conrad for his hard work and dedication to Lakeland Linder and our entire community. It is because of his leadership and passion that Lakeland Linder has become a vital partner throughout our town and Central Florida.  Welcome and congratulations to NOAA! I look forward to a strong partnership for many years to come.   Press release:  https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398589

I am honored to receive the American Conservative Union award today for my conservative voting record on behalf of the wonderful and hardworking folks in District 15 and all Americans. I won't stop fighting for you and our great nation.

Today, I voted to protect consumers and end Wall Street bailouts by helping pass the Financial CHOICE Act. I am proud to stand up for hardworking families, small businesses and community banks in District 15 and across our nation who have been suffocating under the failures of Dodd-Frank. I encourage the Senate to swiftly pass this critical legislation and send it to President Trump's desk so we can provide hardworking Americans the relief they need and deserve.   https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398592

One common thread joins us all across the nation, and that is the unexpected risk posed to our families and communities by natural disasters, like we experienced last year with Hurricanes Hermine and Matthew. This is why I reintroduced my Disaster Savings Accounts (DSA) Act.   This legislation provides critical relief to Americans in disaster-prone states, allowing them to proactively save pre-tax dollars for use toward disaster preparation and recovery expenses. The DSA Act is a common-sense solution that will help keep families and their properties safe, as well as give Americans more control over their money.  For more information on the DSA Act, click on the link below: https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398593

As former Hungarian Ambassador Réka Szemerkényi concludes her service and returns to Hungary this month, I hope that you will join me in thanking her and wishing her all the best. During her time here, she did amazing work to improve and strengthen the friendship between Hungary and the United States.  She also has done a fantastic job reaching out to the Hungarian-American community across our nation, touching so many lives through her passionate advocacy for human rights and diplomacy. I will miss you, my friend. Good luck and God Bless!

Happy Birthday to the United States Army and Happy Flag Day! Thank you to our men and women in uniform who defend and protect our nation, its people and its beautiful stars and stripes. May God continue to watch over you and your families.

Happy Father's Day to all the fathers in District 15, and thank you for all you do! Words cannot describe the joy I have in being a part of my boys' lives and to have watched them grow into the wonderful men they are today. My father influenced me probably more than anyone I know, and truly practiced "family first." He was a quiet, conservative Christian who led by example, and I pray every day that I can follow in his footsteps of love, strength and faith.

Rep. Ross' statement on the Congressional Baseball Practice shooting:  "Cindy’s and my thoughts and prayers are with Whip Scalise, the staff, the Capitol Police officers, and the family and friends of those hurt. Our deep appreciation goes out to the Capitol Police and local law enforcement officers for their protection.”  Congressman Ross did not attend practice this morning, and is doing fine.

Last night's Congressional Baseball Game proved our ability and need to unite as a nation, friends, colleagues and Americans. Our time here on Earth is too precious and fleeting to waste on taking life for granted. Cindy's and my prayers continue to be with Whip Steve Scalise and his family as he recovers from yesterday's tragic shooting, as well as with the Congressional staff, Capitol Police Officers and others wounded by this senseless act of violence. I ask that you join me in thanking our Capitol Police, law enforcement officers and first responders all throughout our nation who selflessly put their lives on the line to serve and protect us every single day. May God continue to bless and watch over them, you all, and our great United States of America!

Floridians and all Americans deserve more affordable choices when it comes to purchasing flood insurance to protect their homes and families. I am happy to announce that Rep. Kathy Castor's and my legislation to provide more flood insurance choices at lower costs passed unanimously out of committee this week. We will continue fighting for this important issue so the bill soon passes the entire House, like it did unanimously last Congress.   To read more on Rep. Ross' Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act, click on the link below:   https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398595

It was great seeing my good friend Polk County Sheriff Grady Judd in D.C. today. I look forward to our continued discussions on how our federal and local governments can work together to improve our broken immigration system and reduce recidivism in our communities.

For years, the lack of immigration enforcement and the spread of dangerous sanctuary city policies have failed the American people and cost too many lives, including Kate Steinle's, Sarah Root's and Grant Ronnebeck's. I voted for Kate's Law and the No Sanctuary for Criminals Act today because we must put an end to these preventable tragedies and enforce the laws of our land.   We are a proud nation of immigrants, but immigration in this country should be focused on earned citizenship, just as my grandparents obtained as Hungarian immigrants. We must place a priority on those who have taken the appropriate legal steps to become a citizen, not on those who have broken the law. It is imperative that we swiftly implement conservative and stringent immigration reform so we can better protect our nation, its people and the true American Dream.   https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398596

Happy Fourth of July! We all have much to celebrate today — the independence of our beautiful nation and the freedom we have to enjoy life. Let us always remember, however, that our freedom isn't free. As we gather with our families and friends today, I ask that you join me in thanking the brave men and women who, for 241 years, have selflessly served, defended and protected our country and its freedom. I pray you all have a wonderful and safe holiday. May God bless you all and the United States of America!

Thank you to everyone who participated in the constituent visit at GEICO today! I greatly appreciate the opportunity to meet with so many wonderful people and discuss with them issues important to District 15, Florida and our nation.

After a half-decade of deep and dangerous cuts made to our defense budget, we are tackling the readiness crisis facing our troops. Today's bipartisan passage of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) allows Congress to meet its most important constitutional obligation to ‘provide for the common defense.'  The NDAA improves policy initiatives and authorizes vital funding the U.S. military requires to keep our defense programs running without putting a price tag on American lives and our country’s security. It also equips, supplies and trains our troops, as well as helps better support them and their families. Our national security is non-negotiable, and we must stand united in improving it every single day.  To read more about the NDAA, click on the link below:  https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398597

Big thanks to Dept. of Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke, my fellow RV Caucus Congressional Members and outdoor recreation industry leaders for the great discussions today about the importance of modernizing U.S. National Parks through public-private partnerships!  Florida is rich with National Parks and provides nearly $1 billion in economic output through the RV industry, with Tampa hosting the largest RV consumer show in North America and the largest single site RV dealership in America. Yet, our National Parks haven’t kept pace.   Park partnerships are a win-win-win solution for the American people, the U.S. economy, and federal land agencies. I look forward to working with my colleagues to determine the best way to modernize our National Parks to allow for their preservation, conservation and enjoyment for generations to come.  https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398598

Whatever the reason may be, "hot car" deaths are completely preventable. As a father who raised children in Florida, which is one of the top three states for child vehicular strokes, this issue hits home. This July marked the deadliest month in nearly a decade for children dying in hot cars in the U.S.   The Hot Cars Act is a common sense bill that will help save children’s lives by requiring cars to come equipped with a simple existing system that reminds drivers if a child, an animal or another person is still in the vehicle after it is turned off. This is an easy first-step solution to preventing these heartbreaking accidents and deaths. I encourage my colleagues to support this legislation so we can put an end to this serious, preventable problem.  http://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/video/life-saving-sensor-created-to-prevent-children-from-dying-in-hot-cars-1021182531883

On this day, we unite as a nation in remembering the tragic events that took place on September 11, 2001. Together we pray for the lives we lost on that heartbreaking day, for the heroic firefighters, police officers and first responders who sacrificed their lives to save others, and for our brave servicemen and women who protect and fight for our country and freedoms every single day. Together, we will never forget.   "In time, perhaps, we will mark the memory of September the 11th in stone and metal -- something we can show children as yet unborn to help them understand what happened on this minute and on this day.  "But for those of us who lived through these events, the only marker we'll ever need is the tick of a clock at the 46th minute of the eighth hour of the 11th day. We will remember where we were and how we felt. We will remember the dead and what we owe them. We will remember what we lost and what we found.  "And in our time, we will honor the memory of the 11th day by doing our duty as citizens of this great country, freedom's home and freedom's defender. God bless." - President George W. Bush

In honor of National POW/MIA Recognition Day, we stand united as a nation in remembering and honoring those captured and who have gone missing while serving our great country. Today, as in every day, we shall live by the POW/MIA flag’s creed: You Are Not Forgotten.  No other country like America has devoted as much energy and so many resources to account for its fallen and missing. We must continue fighting and praying for the speedy and safe return of American Prisoners of War and those still Missing in Action, for our debt to them can never truly be repaid. May God continue to watch over our valiant soldiers, and may God continue to bless the United States of America.

Happy Constitution Day! On this day in 1787, 39 delegates to the Constitutional Convention met at Independence Hall in Philadelphia to finalize and sign the grand document that is still the foundation on which our system of government is built: The Constitution of the United States of America.   As we celebrate this historic day, I encourage you to take a few moments to read the brilliant words of our incredible Constitution. Please remember the vision of those 39 Americans, who believed in a unique society and aimed to secure it for generations to come by establishing a lasting framework of freedom and the rule of law. May God bless you all, and may God continue to bless the United States of America.

UPDATE: FEMA Declares Disaster Relief for Polk County  LAKELAND, Fla. – Sept. 13, 2017 – U.S. Rep. Dennis A. Ross (R-FL-15), Senior Deputy Majority Whip, provided the following statement after FEMA declared Polk County is now included in the Individual Assistance declaration for Hurricane Irma:  “I am incredibly thrilled to announce that FEMA has officially declared Polk County is now included in the Individual Assistance declaration for Hurricane Irma. This declaration will allow individuals in Polk County impacted by the hurricane to receive recovery support and disaster assistance. The people of Polk County desperately need this relief. Folks have lost everything and have suffered so much. I thank FEMA for quickly acting on this declaration.  “Since before Hurricane Irma made landfall, I have been fighting tirelessly to ensure those in my district and throughout the entire state of Florida are safe and have the resources and information needed to protect themselves. I have spoken to FEMA every day, multiple times a day, for nearly a week now to assess the status of and fight for relief for my district and the counties I represent.   “I also want to thank all of the constituents who sent pictures of hurricane damage to their homes, properties and communities to provide proof of the immediate need for this relief. I will continue fighting for the people of District 15. There is much work to be done on this road to recovery, but we are resilient and we will overcome, and this declaration is the first step to this recovery. May God continue to watch over and bless us all.”

Now that Polk County has received an Individual Assistance disaster relief declaration by FEMA due to Hurricane Irma, the IRS is permitted to postpone certain deadlines for taxpayers who reside or have a business in the declared disaster area. I sent a letter to IRS Commissioner Koskinen today, requesting the IRS to immediately postpone these deadlines. Polk County needs this—now.  More Information: https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398607

Individuals in declared disaster relief counties can register with FEMA the following ways:   ~ Apply online at www.DisasterAssistance.gov.    ~ Constituents may call the registration phone number at 1-800-621-3362; those who have a speech disability or hearing loss and use TTY, should call 1-800-462-7585 directly; for those who use 711 or Video Relay Service (VRS), call 1-800-621-3362.

Governor Scott announced today that the Florida Department of Economic Opportunity (DEO) has launched the Florida Small Business Emergency Bridge Loan Program to support businesses impacted by Hurricane Irma to provide short-term, interest-free loans to small businesses that experienced physical or economic damage during the storm.   To complete an application by the Oct. 31, 2017, deadline, visit www.floridadisasterloan.org. For more information contact the Florida Small Business Development Center Network at 850-898-3489 or email Disaster@FloridaSBDC.org.

Congress must support America's veterans exposed to Agent Orange during their service to our nation. My bill, H.R. 809, the FOSTER Act, will provide the necessary care for our heroes who are experiencing the horrible consequences of exposure to this chemical agent.
Just a friendly reminder to those affected that the service academy nomination deadline has been postponed until this Friday, October 13.

I believe that Americans need a reformed flood insurance program, yet today’s vote on additional supplemental appropriations for disaster relief reflects a strange political reality, where debt forgiveness takes priority. Floridians deserve certainty—both that the federal government will honor its debts, but also that it will manage the federal flood insurance program responsibly. We cannot do either of these things without reform.  I supported this supplemental aid package, but I did so only because House leadership assured me that this will be a down payment on reform. I remain committed to ensuring that Congress institutes the reforms Americans expect and restoring fiscal sanity to the National Flood Insurance Program.  The 353-69 vote approves $18.7 billion for the Federal Emergency Management Agency’s (FEMA) disaster relief fund -- including $4.9 billion for a disaster relief loan account -- $16 billion to address national flood insurance program debt and $576.5 for wildfire recovery efforts. It also provided $1.27 billion for disaster food assistance for Puerto Rico. As a member of the House Committee on Financial Services, I've offered legislation that would reform the National Flood Insurance Program and reduce the taxpayer burden for disasters.

The Iran Deal was a sham from the very beginning, based on the ridiculous premise that pallets of cold hard cash would allay Iran’s nuclear ambitions and its continued support of terrorism in the Middle East. Thankfully, the deal has a mechanism for enforcement against Iran’s violations, and President Trump is right to decertify.   The only downside I can see is that we won’t get a refund.

Think about all the things that happened in or since 1986: It was the year we first observed a federal Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, we mourned the tragic Challenger explosion, and the Senate outlawed genocide after waiting 37 years. There was no Internet, home computing was still in its earliest stages, and the Berlin wall still divided Germany. Now realize this: Our tax code hasn’t been overhauled since that time.   All that is about to change. Last week, the Senate passed a budget resolution that paves the way for a major tax overhaul. You know what this means: It’s an opportunity to make life easier for Floridians who want to focus on taking care of our families, growing our businesses, and generally living our lives. It’s also an opportunity to grow our economy and make the government more efficient.  We still have a long way to go, but as your congressman, I plan to fight to ensure that you keep more of your money. After all: You earned it.

Americans want more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks, and with today's vote in support of the budget resolution already passed by the Senate, we’re getting ready to deliver. I will continue to work with my colleagues towards meaningful tax reform.

The US Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS) has announced it will allow construction to commence on Winter Haven’s Lake Maude Park, in advance of the city receiving the required Incidental Take Permit. I urged the Fish and Wildlife Service to support the request.   Over the course of the past two years, Winter Haven has repeatedly contacted USFWS about its application for an ITP, and had not received an adequate response. The city has acquired all necessary permits involved with the construction of the facility, with the exception of the sand skink’s ITP. Furthermore, the City has completed the bidding process for the project and is ready to award the contract and begin construction--should the City not begin construction within the next three months, one of the contractors will pull out of the contract, placing the entire project in financial jeopardy.  I’m glad that the Fish and Wildlife Service came to understand the importance of this project and that further delays would place it in jeopardy. While I’m continuing to work with USFWS to address other projects in my District, this positive outcome shows that we’re making progress.  For more information, check out the link below. https://dennisross.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=398625

Floridians deserve a tax code that allows them to take care of their families, set their own priorities, and grow their businesses. With this tax reform bill, we have taken a serious step forward to provide relief and reform that works for all Americans. Check out the details here at FairandSimple.gop.
This tax reform bill is a positive step that will help middle class families, grow jobs, and make America more competitive. Here's my take.
Our hearts are heavy with sorrow as we learn more about the Texas shooting. My prayers are with the victims and their families.

In recognition of the over 100 million people victimized by communism and the need to raise awareness of those dissidents who continue to protest against current communist regimes, I'm announcing the formation of the Victims of Communism Caucus for the 115th Congress (2017-2019) alongside fellow Representatives Marcy Kaptur (D-OH), Dan Lipinski (D-IL), and Chris Smith (R-NJ).   The Victims of Communism Caucus is a bipartisan group of Members of Congress dedicated to raising awareness of how communism victimized and enslaved more than 100 million people in the past and how its tyranny in the five existing communist countries (China, Cuba, Laos, North Korea, and Vietnam) and its legacy in the post-Soviet sphere shapes international relations today.  We should not be lulled into thinking that communism is no longer a threat to freedom in the world, given that many people still toil under its hateful, totalitarian rule. Our caucus will ensure that we do not forget those victims who were forced to choose between their faith and the cruelty of a dictatorship. We must hold fast to the virtues of freedom.

Yesterday, I got to sit down with a group of students from "Congressional Classroom," a project of the Randy Roberts Foundation intended to connect and cultivate Florida youth who are interested in public service and their communities. It was a great conversation, and I'm warmed to see so many young people genuinely interested in how they can help others.
Holding a telephone townhall with constituents in Florida, discussing tax reform and hurricane relief.

Today, I voted to make taxes lower and simpler for Americans,” said Rep. Ross. “In the 15th District alone, this bill will help the over 50,000 taxpayers who claim the child tax credit. It will help the over 46,000 taxpayers who have small business income. The over 3,000 taxpayers who currently pay the Alternative Minimum Tax won’t have to do so anymore. Filing will be more simple for the over 65,000 taxpayers who itemize their taxes, now that the standard deduction has been doubled.   Residents of the 15th District, the rest of Florida, and the entire nation will be better positioned to keep more of their paychecks, create jobs, and grow the economy with this tax reform.

People like to talk about how this week is about the essentials: turkey, stuffing, cranberry sauce, mashed potatoes, and gravy. This is a meal common among Americans for Thanksgiving. Many of us get to enjoy variations on the same routine: Perhaps a long drive, a football game on television, and a few family members desperate to know how the commute was. Dinner is announced, everyone eats too much, and then someone reaches for the paper to figure out what stores are offering sales worth the hassle. With all this abundance, we know we are blessed.  America has always been a dynamic, changing, and vibrant country, but our traditions remain strong, and we are fortunate to have such a routine. We are the lucky ones that in a world filled with chaos, poverty, and war, we have strong local communities where people come together to help one another. They do so, not because of the government, but because of who we are.   While we have much to be thankful for, many of our neighbors continue to struggle. After a dangerous hurricane season, many have been left displaced or with uncertain futures. But the beauty of America is that we do not forget about those in need. Instead, we get to work. We see it in among our neighbors here at home, where a young boy has inspired his community to support the homeless (http://www.theledger.com/news/20171118/winter-haven-boys-blessing-bags-for-homeless-inspire-others), a local Church plans to give away free Thanksgiving meals (http://www.theledger.com/news/20171119/free-thanksgiving-meals-being-served-wednesday), and our local newspaper continues 49 years of helping neighbors in crisis (http://www.theledger.com/news/20171118/newspaper-with-heart-continues-to-help-neighbors).   This Thanksgiving, I am thankful for all of you, my neighbors, who continue to make the 15th District, the state of Florida, and the entire nation as strong as it is today. I feel very blessed to represent you as your congressman.   Thank you.

We remember.    Seventy-six years later, we remember when the Imperial Japanese Navy Air Service began their descent at 7:48 a.m. Hawaiian time. Three hundred and fifty-three imperial Japanese aircraft commenced a surprise attack that left 2,403 Americans dead and 1,178 wounded.    Many Americans knew that someday, staying out of the war would no longer be possible. Then the war came to us.   That day was tragic given the lives lost and the massive toll on our morale. But secretly, we were blessed.   To the Japanese, with so many American battleships sunk or damaged, our Pacific Fleet seemed to be decimated. But things are not always what they seem. When we would eventually win the war, our Pacific Fleet would not rely on the deployment of battleships. The Japanese didn’t know it, but they bombed the wrong ships.   Victory would come because we would rely on the American aircraft carriers and submarines—the very vessels that the Japanese overlooked. We would rely on our logistical superiority, rooted in the untouched repair yards and the oil tank farms. When we fought the Battle of Midway, we didn’t make the same mistake as Imperial Japan. We bombed the right ships. We sank all four of Japan’s large aircraft carriers—the same ones involved in the initial bombing of Pearl Harbor.   This is a very American story: Out of the ashes of defeat, we rise and we fight. And we win.    We remember Pearl Harbor not as a day of tragedy, but as a call to arms.    We must keep this fighting spirit alive in America today. We must always be ready to heed that call.    I’m thankful for our veterans who have set an example, and for our armed forces that continue to make America strong. God bless our nation.  (Photo from Associated Press here: http://www.stltoday.com/news/national/historical-photos-of-the-attack-on-pearl-harbor/collection_36aa4f15-b804-5e67-a431-e45b3a1b15f1.html)

Floridians stand a great deal to gain with this tax cut. They will be able to keep more of their money and they will have greater opportunities offered by a stronger economy. We’ve simplified the tax code, made it easier to create jobs, and delivered on a promise, with this bill, to make America great again.  Here's what the final bill does:   • Significantly increases the standard deduction to protect roughly double the amount of what you earn each year from taxes – from $6,500 and $13,000 under current law to $12,000 and $24,000 for individuals and married couples, respectively.  • Preserves the mortgage interest deduction – providing tax relief to current and aspiring homeowners.       o For all homeowners with existing mortgages that were taken out to buy a home, there will be no change to the current mortgage interest deduction.      o For homeowners with new mortgages on a first or second home, the home mortgage interest deduction will be available up to $750,000.  • Retains popular retirement savings options such as 401(k)s and Individual Retirement Accounts (IRAs) so Americans can continue to save for their future.  • Expands the Child Tax Credit from $1,000 to $2,000 for single filers and married couples to help parents with the cost of raising children. The tax credit is fully refundable up to $1,400 and begins to phase-out for families making over $400,000. Parents must provide a child’s valid Social Security Number in order to receive this credit.  • Provides relief for Americans with expensive medical bills by expanding the medical expense deduction for 2017 and 2018 for medical expenses exceeding 7.5 percent of adjusted gross income, and rising to 10 percent beginning in 2019.  • Eliminates Obamacare’s individual mandate penalty tax – providing families with much-needed relief and flexibility to buy the health care that’s right for them if they choose.  • Prevents American jobs, headquarters, and research from moving overseas by eliminating incentives that now reward companies for shifting jobs, profits, and manufacturing plants abroad.  • Provides support for graduate students by continuing to exempt the value of reduced tuition from taxes.
Discussing the new tax bill just passed out of the House.

With President Trump’s signature on our tax reform bill today, Floridians will get to keep more of their hard earned money. They will also enjoy a boom in job creation and new opportunities. From simplifying the tax code to doubling the child tax credit and the standard deduction, this new law means Florida families and businesses will enjoy a thriving economy for years to come.  For those of you who are skeptical: I don't blame you--for the last few years, we've heard promises from government officials that either never got delivered on, or turned out to have some big strings attached. But don't be misled about this tax reform: It's big for our economy, and especially for Florida.   In that spirit, here's an article that clarifies some of the biggest myths about the tax reform that President Trump just signed into law.   Share it.

http://dennisross.house.gov/constituentservices/serviceacademynominations.htm  Rep. Ross welcomes high school students from District 15 to the U.S. Service Academy Information Day to learn more about the Service Academy appointment process.   The following schools will be in attendance: U.S. Military Academy, U.S. Air Force Academy, U.S. Naval Academy, U.S. Coast Guard Academy, U.S. Merchant Marine Academy and Florida Southern College Army ROTC.  Rep. Ross makes nominations for the five different U.S. Service Academies, up to ten candidates for each vacancy at each Academy, and the Academies make the final appointment decisions.   Each congressional member may not have more than five midshipmen or cadets at each Academy at one time. Therefore, new applicants are considered only when a vacancy occurs in the quota through graduation or other causes. Acceptance of an appointment commits an applicant to a 10-year obligation to the Service (four years at the Academy and six years on active duty).
